nodes.text: An IoT based home automation system can provide low cost, wireless, scalable control of household appliances with remote and automated operation to improve energy efficiency, accessibility, and user convenience
Home automation systems provide centralized control and remote monitoring of lighting, security, and other home appliances to improve energy efficiency, security, comfort, and convenience
Current barriers to widespread adoption include system complexity and cost, which particularly limit benefits for the elderly and people with disabilities

Design objectives for the proposed system: integrate all appliances into a networked Home Automation System, provide switch and voice control, show device status in an app, support any WiFi capable device, and ensure scalability for adding functions and devices

The proposed prototype implements an Android client app communicating over WiFi using socket programming with features switch mode, voice mode, secure communication, and hardware modules including Arduino UNO, Bluetooth HC05, relay module, PCB, and power supply

Smart home concepts and prior literature demonstrate IoT can convert appliances to intelligent devices and enable energy efficient remote control using microcontrollers, MQTT, voice assistants, and always-on WiFi

The app implements two control modes: Switch Mode where UI switches send state via radio button, and Voice Mode where smartphone microphone sends voice intent to Google's servers, which returns parsed strings for command processing
System design requirement: control must be possible from any WiFi capable device (Android, iOS, PC) to provide flexible secure access to home appliances
Prototype implements wireless remote switching for appliances and displays device status in the smartphone application
Voice and switch commands from the Android app are sent via socket communication over WiFi to the microcontroller which actuates relays to control appliances
Communication is secured using SSL over TCP or SSH according to the prototype description
Related systems use components such as NodeMCU, MQTT brokers, Google Assistant, Raspberry Pi servers, motion and smoke sensors, and camera modules to add energy efficiency and security features
Acknowledged challenge: system complexity and cost remain barriers to adoption despite technical feasibility

Prototype outcomes reported: approximately 150 foot indoor WiFi control range, ability to switch devices via app or voice, cross-device control from any WiFi enabled device, secure control, simple expandable design, and low cost

Conclusion: A low cost, WiFi based IoT prototype can achieve remote and voice controlled switching, device status display, and secure access, demonstrating feasibility of the proposed home automation objectives while recognizing scalability and accessibility goals
